Enumerations

Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the data structures which are exposed to the application.

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct CBUFF_BufferCfg_t CBUFF_BufferCfg

CBUFF Buffer configuration.

This is a generic data structure which is exposed to the application to pass buffer configuration to the drivers. This is used to populate the User Buffers and Headers which can be streamed out via CBUFF to the selected High speed interface.

typedef enum CBUFF_Command_e CBUFF_Command

CBUFF Command.

The enumeration describes commands which are used to get/set information from the CBUFF Driver

See also
CBUFF_control
typedef struct CBUFF_CSICfg_t CBUFF_CSICfg

CBUFF CSI configuration.

The structure describes the configuration which is required to use the CBUFF with the CSI as a high speed interface

typedef enum CBUFF_DataFmt_e CBUFF_DataFmt

Data Format.

The enumeration describes the data format.

typedef enum CBUFF_DataMode_e CBUFF_DataMode

Data Storage Mode.

The enumeration describes the storage mode in which the data is stored in the ADC Buffer.

typedef enum CBUFF_DataType_e CBUFF_DataType

Data Type.

The enumeration describes the data type

typedef int32_t(* CBUFF_EDMAChannelAllocateFxn) (CBUFF_EDMAInfo *ptrEDMAInfo, CBUFF_EDMAChannelCfg *ptrEDMAChannelCfg)

Description
This is the function which is registered with the CBUFF driver and is invoked by the driver whenever it needs to allocate and use an EDMA channel.

Parameters
[in]dmaNumDMA Number to be used for EDMA channel allocation
[in]ptrEDMAInfoPointer to the EDMA informational block which needs to be used by the application to perform the EDMA channel allocation
[out]ptrEDMAChannelCfgPointer to the EDMA Channel configuration which is to be populated
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0 [Implies that the application is unable to allocate a channel]

NOTE: The EDMA transfer completion codes are identical to the CBUFF Physical & chain channel resources therefore these transfer completion codes are considered to be reserved for CBUFF Usage.

typedef struct CBUFF_EDMAChannelCfg_t CBUFF_EDMAChannelCfg

CBUFF EDMA channel resource configuration.

The structure describes the EDMA channel resources which are needed by the CBUFF driver in order to stream out the data over the high speed interface.

typedef void(* CBUFF_EDMAChannelFreeFxn) (CBUFF_EDMAChannelCfg *ptrEDMAChannelCfg)

Description
This is the function which is registered with the CBUFF driver and is invoked by the driver whenever it needs to free an allocated EDMA channel.

Parameters
[in]ptrEDMAChannelCfgPointer to the EDMA chnanel configuration which is to be released
Return values
Notapplicable
typedef struct CBUFF_EDMAInfo_t CBUFF_EDMAInfo

CBUFF EDMA Information block.

The structure describes the EDMA informational block which is passed to the application. The information here requires to be used by the application before performing an EDMA channel allocation.

typedef void(* CBUFF_FrameDoneCallbackFxn) (CBUFF_SessionHandle sessionHandle)

Description
Sessions can register for Frame Done interrupts. This callback function is invoked if the session is currently active and the CBUFF Driver receives a frame done interrupt. Application should use this to activate another session. Switching between active sessions while the frame is not done can lead to unexpected results.

Parameters
[in]sessionHandleSession Handle which was active for which the Frame done interrupt was received
Return values
Notapplicable
typedef enum CBUFF_HeaderMode_e CBUFF_HeaderMode

Header Mode.

The enumeration describes the header mode. The CBUFF driver can add headers to the data before it is sent out over the CSI/LVDS.

typedef struct CBUFF_HwSessionCfg_t CBUFF_HwSessionCfg

CBUFF Hardware Triggered Session configuration.

The structure describes the configuration required to be specified if the session is created in hardware triggered mode.

typedef struct CBUFF_InitCfg_t CBUFF_InitCfg

CBUFF Initialization Configuration.

The structure describes the configuration which is required to initialize the CBUFF Driver.

typedef enum CBUFF_Interface_e CBUFF_Interface

High Speed Interface.

The enumeration describes the high speed interface which is to be used by the CBUFF to send out the data

typedef struct CBUFF_LVDSCfg_t CBUFF_LVDSCfg

CBUFF LVDS Initialization configuration.

The structure describes the configuration which is required to configure the LVDS

typedef enum CBUFF_LVDSLaneFmtMap_e CBUFF_LVDSLaneFmtMap

LVDS Lane Format Map.

The enumeration describes the LVDS Lane Format maps which are available and which need to be used.

typedef enum CBUFF_OperationalMode_e CBUFF_OperationalMode

CBUFF Operational Mode.

The enumeration describes the operational mode for the CBUFF

typedef enum CBUFF_OutputDataFmt_e CBUFF_OutputDataFmt

Output Data Format.

The enumeration describes the LVDS/CSI2 output data format.

typedef struct CBUFF_SessionCfg_t CBUFF_SessionCfg

CBUFF configuration.

The structure describes the configuration which is required to configure the CBUFF Driver.

typedef enum CBUFF_SessionExecuteMode_e CBUFF_SessionExecuteMode

Session Execution Mode.

The enumeration describes the execution mode for the sessions. Sessions can be automatically triggered by the hardware or these need to be triggered manually by the CBUFF Driver.

typedef struct CBUFF_Stats_t CBUFF_Stats

CBUFF Statistics.

The structure describes the CBUFF statistics which can be used to determine the behavior of the CBUFF module.

typedef struct CBUFF_SwSessionCfg_t CBUFF_SwSessionCfg

CBUFF Software Triggered Session configuration.

The structure describes the configuration required to be specified if the session is created in software triggered mode.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum CBUFF_Command_e

CBUFF Command.

The enumeration describes commands which are used to get/set information from the CBUFF Driver

See also
CBUFF_control
Enumerator
CBUFF_Command_GET_CBUFF_STATS 

The command is used to get the statistics associated with the CBUFF driver. While using this command in the CBUFF_control API; please ensure the following:- arg = &CBUFF_Stats argLen = sizeof(CBUFF_Stats)

See also
CBUFF_Stats
CBUFF_Command_CLEAR_CBUFF_STATS 

The command is used to clear the statistics associated with the CBUFF driver. While using this command in the CBUFF_control API; please ensure the following:- arg = NULL argLen = 0.

CBUFF_Command_GET_ACTIVE_SESSION 

The command is used to get the current active session in the CBUFF Driver. While using this command in the CBUFF_control API; please ensure the following:- arg = &CBUFF_SessionHandle argLen = sizeof(CBUFF_SessionHandle)

If session handle is marked as NULL it implies that there was no active session in the CBUFF driver.

enum CBUFF_DataFmt_e

Data Format.

The enumeration describes the data format.

Enumerator
CBUFF_DataFmt_ADC_DATA 

Only ADC Data is to sent out.

CBUFF_DataFmt_CP_ADC 

Chirp Parameters + ADC Data.

CBUFF_DataFmt_ADC_CP 

ADC Data + Chirp Parameters.

CBUFF_DataFmt_CP_ADC_CQ 

Chirp Parameters + ADC Data + Chirp Quality.

CBUFF_DataFmt_ADC_USER 

ADC + User Data.

CBUFF_DataFmt_CP_ADC_CQ_USER 

Chirp Parameters + ADC Data + Chirp Quality + User Data.

CBUFF_DataFmt_MAX 

Maximum Data format value.

enum CBUFF_DataMode_e

Data Storage Mode.

The enumeration describes the storage mode in which the data is stored in the ADC Buffer.

Enumerator
CBUFF_DataMode_INTERLEAVED 

Data is stored in interleaved mode. This implies that sample of each receive channel is stored one after another.

CBUFF_DataMode_NON_INTERLEAVED 

Data is stored in non-interleaved mode. This implies that all the samples of a receive channel are grouped together.

enum CBUFF_DataType_e

Data Type.

The enumeration describes the data type

Enumerator
CBUFF_DataType_REAL 

Real Data.

CBUFF_DataType_COMPLEX 

Complex Data.

enum CBUFF_HeaderMode_e

Header Mode.

The enumeration describes the header mode. The CBUFF driver can add headers to the data before it is sent out over the CSI/LVDS.

Enumerator
CBUFF_HeaderMode_NONE 

No header is added.

CBUFF_HeaderMode_CUSTOM 

Custom application specific headers.

enum CBUFF_Interface_e

High Speed Interface.

The enumeration describes the high speed interface which is to be used by the CBUFF to send out the data

Enumerator
CBUFF_Interface_CSI 

The CBUFF driver will send out the packets using the CSI Interface.

CBUFF_Interface_LVDS 

The CBUFF driver will send out the packets using the LVDS Interface.

enum CBUFF_LVDSLaneFmtMap_e

LVDS Lane Format Map.

The enumeration describes the LVDS Lane Format maps which are available and which need to be used.

Enumerator
CBUFF_LVDSLaneFmtMapLANEx_FMT_0_y 

Use the LVDS Lane Format-0.

CBUFF_LVDSLaneFmtMapLANEx_FMT_1_y 

Use the LVDS Lane Format-1.

enum CBUFF_OperationalMode_e

CBUFF Operational Mode.

The enumeration describes the operational mode for the CBUFF

Enumerator
CBUFF_OperationalMode_CHIRP 

The CBUFF sends out the data on the High speed interface based on the number of chirps.

CBUFF_OperationalMode_CONTINUOUS 

The CBUFF sends out the data on the High speed interface based on the threshold. This is only supported on LVDS.

enum CBUFF_OutputDataFmt_e

Output Data Format.

The enumeration describes the LVDS/CSI2 output data format.

Enumerator
CBUFF_OutputDataFmt_12bit 

12bit output format

CBUFF_OutputDataFmt_14bit 

14bit output format

CBUFF_OutputDataFmt_16bit 

16bit output format

enum CBUFF_SessionExecuteMode_e

Session Execution Mode.

The enumeration describes the execution mode for the sessions. Sessions can be automatically triggered by the hardware or these need to be triggered manually by the CBUFF Driver.

Enumerator
CBUFF_SessionExecuteMode_HW 

CBUFF Transfers are triggered by the hardware.

CBUFF_SessionExecuteMode_SW 

CBUFF Transfers are triggered by the driver.
